im new to linux, i don't really know what im doing hehe :(
you used dpkg-divert and didn't remove the diversion
you followed the firfoxNewVersion wiki to install ff1.5 right?
it tells you to use dpkg-divert and make sure you remove the diversion if you remove ff1.5
sudo dpkg-divert --remove /usr/bin/firefox will remove the diversion
use checkinstall to install it instead
it creates a .deb and installs it for your. you can then use dpkg -r to uninstall
not all source packages provides an uninstall mecanism, but with those that do you can unstall with make uninstall from the source dir if you kept it
what if I did not keep it?
then you're probably fsck'ed or you can redownload and compile/install then make uninstall
not all source packages provides make uninstall though, but most do
instead of sudo make install you just type sudo checkinstall
stupid question: using checkinstall so I then target the .tar.gz folder or the files itself?
you ./configure and make as usual. at the point where you would sudo make install you would then sudo checkinstall instead
